circumstances: While cruising by night in marginal weather conditions (low clouds), the airplane struck the slope of a mountain located near Carpinteria. The aircraft was destroyed by impact forces and a post crash fire and the pilot, sole on board, was killed. The wreckage was found two days later.
probable_cause:
Controlled flight into terrain following improper in-flight decisions on part of the pilot. The following contributing factors were reported:
- Electrical failure, 
- Low ceiling, 
- High obstructions, 
- Ceiling at 3,000 feet,
- Both generators and batteries failed in flight.
